items: Understand what a while loop is
Write basic while loops to repeat code
Use conditions to control when a loop stops

sections.heading: What is a while loop?
paragraphs: A while loop repeats code as long as a condition is true. It is useful when you do not know in advance how many times to repeat something.
If the condition never becomes False, the loop runs forever (an infinite loop).

sections.heading: Example 2 – Infinite loop (be careful)
bullets: Always update variables inside the loop to eventually stop.

sections.heading: Try it
bullets: Write a while loop that prints numbers from 10 down to 1.
Write a while loop that asks the user to type 'exit'. Keep looping until they do.
while repeats as long as a condition is true
Make sure the condition eventually becomes False
Useful when the number of repetitions is unknown

questions.prompt: What does a while loop do?
choices: Repeats code a fixed number of times
Repeats code as long as a condition is true

questions.prompt: What happens if the condition in a while loop never becomes False?
In the code i=1; while i <= 4: print('Hello'); i = i + 1 — how many times is 'Hello' printed?
